In brief, the perfection of the effort to fulfill the needs of sentient beings manifests in the equality of mind towards all sentient beings;

Moreover, there is another meaning:
The first is like being sick;

Moreover, it manifests:
The first is the power of great compassion;

The third is the power of body and mind;

It manifests in this way.
Moreover, there is another meaning:
The first is speaking of not abandoning any sentient beings;
The second is attaining the power, the four forms of fearlessness, the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha, and all the Buddha Dharmas;
The third is attaining a body that is free from blame;
Fourth, attaining the world in accord with the unsurpassed Dharma King of the Buddhas.
Moreover, there is another meaning:
The exertion of vigor in fulfilling sentient beings is for the sake of manifesting the perfections of giving and vigor;
The exertion of vigor in fulfilling the Buddha Dharma is for the sake of the perfections of wisdom and knowledge;
The exertion of vigor in perfecting the major and minor marks is for the sake of the perfections of patience and skillful means;
The exertion of vigor in purifying the Buddha lands is for the sake of the perfections of morality and meditation.
Thus it is manifested.
